item.title: Litter not being picked up, 20th January
item.description:
Litter all over no kerbside litter picking - there is no street cleaning happening on Battery Road and the area. The lorry with brushes used to visit many months ago especially when cars are parked so that the middle of the road is cleaned and the litter on the kerbside is forgotten about. Please see Royal Arsenal Estate that is in walking distance which is well looked after and maintained - there is no litter there.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Battery Road, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole, 20th January
item.description:
Large pothole (which is growing) in the carriageway beside the church. While you are on site fixing the one at the junction with PWR, this one should be fixed as well. To be honest the whole of the Tudor way road surface is degrading there are continual patching needed. Maybe it would be just more cost efficient to just resurface. Tudor way is a major route through Petts Wood.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tudor Way, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coniston Road, Barnehurst, Greater London

item.title: Woodlands Avenue needs resurfacing. There are potholes, deep uneven surfaces down the whole road., 20th January
item.description:
The road surface is becoming very uneven which is causing damage to cars wheels. There are deep holes in the road. These need to be looked at urgently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Woodlands Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped fridge and some other household items on Norway Gate/Redriff Road, 20th January
item.description:
Someone has dumped a fridge and some other items in the usual fly tipping hot spot on the corner of Norway Gate and Redriff Road. Please can this be removed as soon as possible. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Norway Gate, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are water running from sewage for over a week and no one is handling..., 20th January
item.description:
Water are bursting under the sidewalk and flowing into the road for over a week thats quitr a waste and a safety hazard. Its on finchely road across the road from number 300, near the business school.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 326, Finchley Road, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manner Road has been closed off. It’s taking two hours to get from KFC Mannor Road Freleigh Green. This is absolutely, 20th January
item.description:
Mannor Road in Erith has been closed off due to 4 inch pipe being placed across the road at KFC. It is taking two hours to drive through Slate Green to go just 30 seconds from the end of Mannor Road Street in Erith should be open to allow cars and small vans to drive along the main road at Morrison supermarket. How long is this road gonna be dug up for cause everyone in the area thousands of people I’ll be in affected by a very very poor planning by shutting a major road like a Mannor Road and all it would take would take out two bollards on Apple Street and in all the traffic could travel on the main road at Morrison supermarket very clever.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Manor Road, North End, Erith, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter all over the "pocket park", 20th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westerley Crescent, Perry Vale, Greater London

item.title: What is This?, 20th January
item.description:
What is this thing? It sits outside Sainsbury's but has clearly been wrecked and is completely useless now. It simply gets abused by the people lingering outside the betting shop. Can this be removed? It serves no purpose, seeing as its drowning in cigarette butts.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vandalised disabled Bay SE5 8JW, 20th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vestry Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter and Rodents, 20th January
item.description:
I think its about time Sainsbury's pull their finger out and sort this shocking mess out outside their entrance (I believe this area is their responsibility?). The shrubs are swimming in litter which attracts rats. The whole area outside the store is in rapid decline, mostly due to the people lingering and littering outside that betting shop. Time to get rid of those stone planters maybe? This would eliminate the hidden litter and rodent issue. Maybe time to get rid of that betting shop too.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Christmas trees, 20th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vicarage Grove, Camberwell, Greater London
